#Text=How to Make Vegan Cupcakes
#Text=Two Methods :
#Text=Basic Vanilla Vegan Cupcakes
#Text=Basic Chocolate Vegan Cupcakes
#Text=No need to give up wicked cakes when you toss the eggs , butter , and milk !
#Text=Here 's a great vegan cupcake recipe to use as a base for whatever flavored icing you want to add to it .
#Text=They 're guaranteed to be light and fluffy and perfect for any occasion .
#Text=Ingredients
#Text=Method 1 : Basic Vanilla Vegan Cupcakes :
#Text=Servings : 18 - 24 ( fewer if you opt for larger - sized cupcakes )
#Text=1 tablespoon ( 15 ml ) apple cider vinegar
#Text=1 1/2 cups ( 350 ml ) plain soy milk
#Text=2 3/4 cups ( 345 g ) self raising flour
#Text=2 teaspoons ( 10 g ) baking powder
#Text=1/2 teaspoon baking soda
#Text=1/2 teaspoon salt
#Text=1 cup ( 200 g ) sugar
#Text=1/2 cup ( 120 ml ) vegetable oil
#Text=1 teaspoon vanilla extract
#Text=Vegan icing of your choice
#Text=Method 2 : Basic Chocolate Vegan Cupcakes :
#Text=Makes approx : 20 - 24 cupcakes :
#Text=275 g ( 2 cups ) plain or all - purpose flour ( sifted )
#Text=100 g ( 3/4 cup ) quality cocoa powder ( sifted )
#Text=2 teaspoons baking soda
#Text=1 teaspoon baking powder
#Text=Pinch of salt
#Text=450 ml ( 1 - 3/4 cup ) unsweetened soy milk
#Text=2 teaspoons red wine or apple cider vinegar
#Text=320 g ( 1 - 2/3 cups ) caster / superfine sugar
#Text=320 ml ( 1 - 1/4 cups ) sunflower oil ( or coconut oil )
#Text=2 tablespoons vanilla extract / essence
#Text=Method 1 of 2 : Basic Vanilla Vegan Cupcakes .
#Text=Preheat the oven to 180 o C / 350 o F .
#Text=Prepare the muffin tray by adding cupcake holders / cases .
#Text=Put to one side .
#Text=Alternatively , use a silicone cupcake baking sheet with molded holes .
#Text=Put the cider vinegar into a small bowl and add the soy milk .
#Text=Stir this well and then put to one side .
#Text=The mixture will now curdle and this is what should be happening .
#Text=Stir together the flour , sugar , baking powder , baking soda and salt .
#Text=If you want chocolate cupcakes , add cocoa ( about 1/2 cup ) to this stage .
#Text=Stir the oil and vanilla extract into the bowl containing the soy milk and vinegar .
#Text=Mix together .
#Text=Add the wet ingredients to the dry ingredients and beat together ( by hand or with an electric hand - held mixer ) .
#Text=Fill the muffin pan .
#Text=Usually fill each paper cupcake holder with about 1/4 cup of batter .
#Text=If you prefer larger cupcakes , then add a half a cup but make sure the muffin pan is larger and the cupcake holders are bigger .
#Text=Bake for 18 - 20 minutes .
#Text=If you can smell the cupcakes earlier , check to make sure they are n't browning earlier ( this means they 're more than ready ) .
#Text=If you are n't certain , turn off the oven earlier and let them sit for a few more minutes rather than bake them into rocks .
#Text=Wait for the pan to cool down .
#Text=Place cupcakes onto a wire rack to cool .
#Text=Ice the cupcakes .
#Text=The flavor of icing or frosting can be improved by adding a little of your favorite juice to it instead of soy milk or water .
#Text=Finished .
#Text=Method 2 of 2 : Basic Chocolate Vegan Cupcakes
#Text=Preheat the oven to 160 o C / 315 o F .
#Text=If using cupcake cases , arrange on a baking sheet now .
#Text=If using a silicone cupcake sheet , simply have it ready .
#Text=Add the flour , cocoa powder , baking soda and pinch of salt to the mixing bowl .
#Text=Mix to combine .
#Text=Pour the soy milk , vinegar , sugar , oil and vanilla into another bowl .
#Text=Whisk together well .
#Text=Pour the liquid mixture into the flour mixture .
#Text=Stir to combine thoroughly .
#Text=Pour into the cupcake cases or cupcake holes .
#Text=Place into the oven .
#Text=Bake for 20 to 25 minutes .
#Text=If they smell strongly earlier , test with a wooden skewer ; if it returns clean after sticking into a cupcake , they 're ready .
#Text=Remove from the oven .
#Text=Transfer the cupcakes to a wire cooling rack as quickly as possible when cool enough to handle .
#Text=Let cool completely on the rack .
#Text=Frost as desired .
#Text=Add standard frosting or make vegan butter cream .
#Text=Tips
#Text=You can add pureed fruit for delicious flavor changes .
#Text=One small container of pureed fruit is sufficient for flavoring ( the little containers that children take to school in their lunchboxes . )
#Text=Try strawberry , apple , banana , apricot , peach etc.
#Text=The cupcakes will not be as light and fluffy , however , so be prepared for a heavier cupcake if you add fruit but the added moisture content is a definite plus .
#Text=Instead of using vegan sugar , you can replace it with equal parts maple sugar or rice syrup
#Text=Instead of using vegetable oil , try substituting it for walnut or macadamia nut oils if they are available to you .
#Text=Coconut oil also produces good results .
#Text=And olive oil works fine if it 's all that 's left in the pantry .
#Text=You can replace the plain soy milk with other flavors like chocolate or vanilla if you want to experiment with changing the flavor of the cupcakes .
#Text=Experiment with the flavors of either recipe by replacing the vanilla extract with fragrant ingredients like neroli orange oil , rosewater , orange blossom water or coconut extract .

#Text=Two recipes for 18 - 24 vegan cupcakes ( with vanilla extract for vanilla , or cocoa for chocolate flavor ) , using soy milk and cider vinegar , sugar , baking powder , baking soda , oil and salt , as well as optionally fruit puree , baked in the oven for around 20 minutes .
